isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - ELECTRONIC ENGINES, CUMMINS M11E AND N14E - OPERATION - Radiator Coolant Level Switch (342)

svcprocinfo.para: The Coolant Level Sensor is a fluid-level-actuated switch that sends coolant low or coolant high signal and provides a warning when coolant is being lost. It is mounted in the coolant surge tank.

It is an electronic switch that operates on the electrostatic or capacitance principle, and cannot be tested with a multimeter. The probe extends into the coolant and produces a change in capacitance when coolant displaces air immediately surrounding the probe. This change is converted in the switch to an On/Off solid state switch closure indicating the absence or presence of coolant.
The switch is electrically insulated providing a slick, non-fouling surface as well as good electrical characteristics to prevent current flow into the coolant.
The low coolant level switch connects to the engine harness at connector (342). Four circuits from (342) connect to the ECM through International 21-way connector (312).

svcsubproc.title: Low Coolant Level Switch Operation
svcsubproc.para: The Coolant Level Switch (342) receives a 5 VDC signal on circuit 34B(5V) at terminal C from connector (312) terminal J.

When the coolant level is above the probe, the switch sends a HIGH signal (3.5 volts minimum) from switch terminal D on circuit 34A to connector (312) terminal L. At the same time the switch sends a LOW signal (0.5 volt maximum) from terminal A on circuit 34 to connector (312) terminal M.

When the coolant level is below the probe, the switch sends a HIGH signal (3.5 volts minimum) from the switch terminal A on circuit 34 to connector (312) terminal M. At the same time the switch sends a LOW signal (0.5 volt maximum) from terminal D on circuit 34A to connector (312) terminal L.
The Low Coolant Level switch is grounded from terminal B, circuit 34-G through connector (312) terminal K.

note.para: Because of the solid state circuitry design, the Low Coolant Level Switch cannot be reliably tested using a multimeter.
